â
'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}}, {{FWB|GGQ1}}) is a [[Multinational|multinational]] [[Public company|public]] [[Cloud computing|cloud computing]] and [[Internet search]] technologies [[corporation]] that hosts and develops [[List of Google products|a number]] of [[Internet]]-based services and products. Google was founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while the two were attending [[Stanford University]] as Ph.D. candidates. It was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on [[September 4]], [[1998]], with its [[initial public offering]] to follow on [[August 19]], [[2004]]. Its headquarters, located in [[Mountain View, California]], is often referred to as the [[Googleplex]], which is derived from the number [[googolplex]]. It runs over one million servers in [[data centers]] around the world,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.pandia.com/sew/481-gartner.html |title=Pandia Search Engine News â Google: one million servers and counting |date=2007-07-02 |publisher=Pandia Search Engine News |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref> processing over one billion search requests each day<ref>{{cite web |url=http://politicalticker.blogs.cnn.com/2009/12/18/google-unveils-top-political-searches-of-2009/ |title=CNN Politics â Political Ticker... Google unveils top political searches of 2009 |first=Eric |last=Kuhn |date=2009-12-18 |publisher=CNN |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref> and about one [[petabyte]] of user-generated data each hour.<ref name="googlopoly">{{cite web |url=http://www.wired.com/techbiz/it/magazine/17-08/mf_googlopoly?currentPage=all |title=Why Is Obama's Top Antitrust Cop Gunning for Google? |first=Fred |last=Vogelstein |date=2009-07-20 |publisher=Wired Magazine |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref> Even the company's name, Google, was a play on the large number [[googol]] to represent the large amount of information the company set out to organize. <ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.google.com/corporate/history.html |title=Google Milestones |publisher=Google Inc. |accessdate=14 February 2010}}</ref>
+
'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}}, {{FWB|GGQ1}}) is a [[Multinational|multinational]] [[Public company|public]] [[Cloud computing|cloud computing]] and [[Internet search]] technologies [[corporation]] that hosts and develops [[List of Google products|a number]] of [[Internet]]-based services and products, generating profit primarily from [[advertising]] through its [[AdWords]] program.<ref name="financialtables">{{cite web |url=http://investor.google.com/fin_data.html |title=Financial Tables |publisher=Google Investor Relations |accessdate=2008-01-31}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Online Ads Give Google Huge Gain in Profit |author=David A. Vise |url=David A. Vise |newspaper=The Washington Post |date=2005-10-21 |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref> Google was founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while the two were attending [[Stanford University]] as Ph.D. candidates. It was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on [[September 4]], [[1998]], with its [[initial public offering]] to follow on [[August 19]], [[2004]]. Its headquarters, located in [[Mountain View, California]], is often referred to as the [[Googleplex]], which is derived from the number [[googolplex]]. The company's [[mission statement|stated mission]] from the outset was "to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful",<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.google.com/corporate/ |title=Google Corporate Information |publisher=Google, Inc. |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref> and the company's unofficial slogan, coined by Google engineer [[Paul Buchheit]], was ''[[Don't be evil]]''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://investor.google.com/conduct.html |title=Google Code of Conduct |date=2009-04-08 |publisher=Google, Inc. |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://blogoscoped.com/archive/2007-07-16-n55.html |title=Paul Buchheit on Gmail, AdSense and More |first=Philip|last=Lenssen |date=2007-07-16 |publisher=Google Blogscoped |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref> It runs over one million servers in [[data centers]] around the world,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.pandia.com/sew/481-gartner.html |title=Pandia Search Engine News â Google: one million servers and counting |date=2007-07-02 |publisher=Pandia Search Engine News |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref> processing over one billion search requests every day<ref>{{cite web |url=http://politicalticker.blogs.cnn.com/2009/12/18/google-unveils-top-political-searches-of-2009/ |title=CNN Politics â Political Ticker... Google unveils top political searches of 2009 |first=Eric |last=Kuhn |date=2009-12-18 |publisher=CNN |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref> and about one [[petabyte]] of user-generated data each hour.<ref name="googlopoly">{{cite web |url=http://www.wired.com/techbiz/it/magazine/17-08/mf_googlopoly?currentPage=all |title=Why Is Obama's Top Antitrust Cop Gunning for Google? |first=Fred |last=Vogelstein |date=2009-07-20 |publisher=Wired Magazine |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref> Even the company's name, Google, was a play on the large number [[googol]] to represent the large amount of information the company set out to organize. <ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.google.com/corporate/history.html |title=Google Milestones |publisher=Google Inc. |accessdate=14 February 2010}}</ref>
â
Google's rapid growth has sparked a sequence of new products, [[List of Google acquisitions|acquisitions]] and [[Google#Partnerships|partnerships]] beyond its core [[search engine]]. The company offers online [[productivity]] [[software]], including its [[Gmail]] [[e-mail]] software, [[Google Calendar]], [[Google Reader]] [[news aggregator]], and [[Google Docs]] word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation program. Google has also entered the [[social networking]] market with [[Orkut]], [[Google Profiles]], and Google Buzz. Furthermore, the company's products have been extended to the [[Desktop environment|desktop]] with applications such as Google's web browser [[Google Chrome]], [[Picasa]] photo organization and editing software, [[Google Talk]] [[instant messaging]] application, and [[Google Earth]] virtual globe simulator. More notably, Google created the [[Android (operating system)|Android]] [[mobile phone]] [[operating system]], used on a number of [[HTC]] phones such as the [[Nexus One]] and [[Droid Eris]]. The company generates profits primarily from [[advertising]] through its [[AdWords]] program, which is diplayed on a number of its services, including the [[YouTube]] [[video sharing]] website it acquiesced in [[November]] 2006.<ref name="financialtables">{{cite web |url=http://investor.google.com/fin_data.html |title=Financial Tables |publisher=Google Investor Relations |accessdate=2008-01-31}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Online Ads Give Google Huge Gain in Profit |author=David A. Vise |url=David A. Vise |newspaper=The Washington Post |date=2005-10-21 |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref>
+
Google's rapid growth has sparked a sequence of new products, [[List of Google acquisitions|acquisitions]] and [[Google#Partnerships|partnerships]] beyond its core [[search engine]]. The company offers online [[productivity]] [[software]], such as its [[Gmail]] [[e-mail]] software, and [[social networking]] tools, including [[Orkut]] and, more recently, Google Buzz. Furthermore, the company's products have been extended to the [[Desktop environment|desktop]] with applications such as Google's web browser [[Google Chrome]], the [[Picasa]] photo organization and editing software, and [[Google Talk]] [[instant messaging]] application. More notably, Google created the [[Android (operating system)|Android]] [[mobile phone]] [[operating system]], used on a number of [[HTC]] phones such as the [[Nexus One]] and [[Droid Eris]]. Because of its popularity and numerous products, [[Alexa Internet|Alexa]] lists Google as the Internet's most visited website.<ref>{{cite web |title=Alexa Traffic Rank for Google (three month average) |publisher=[[Alexa Internet]] |url=http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/google.com |accessdate=2009-09-06}}</ref> Google is also [[Fortune Magazine]]'s fourth best place to work<ref name="best_company">{{cite web |url=http://money.cnn.com/magazines/fortune/bestcompanies/2010/full_list/ |title=100 Best Companies to Work For 2010 |work=Fortune Maganize |date=2010-02-08 |publisher=CNN |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref>, and [[BrandZ]]'s most powerful brand in the world.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.millwardbrown.com/Sites/optimor/Media/Pdfs/en/BrandZ/BrandZ-2009-Report.pdf |title=Top 100 Most Powerful Brands of 2009 |year=2008 |publisher=BrandZ |page=9 |format=PDF |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref> However, Google has been [[Criticism of Google|criticized]] over issues of [[privacy]] of personal information, [[copyright]] and [[censorship by Google|censorship]] within the broad range of services that the company's products covers.
â   â
The company's [[mission statement|stated mission]] from the outset was "to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.google.com/corporate/ |title=Google Corporate Information |publisher=Google, Inc. |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref> Its unofficial slogan, coined by [[Gmail]]'s first engineer, [[Paul Buchheit]], was ''[[Don't be evil]]''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://investor.google.com/conduct.html |title=Google Code of Conduct |date=2009-04-08 |publisher=Google, Inc. |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://blogoscoped.com/archive/2007-07-16-n55.html |title=Paul Buchheit on Gmail, AdSense and More |first=Philip|last=Lenssen |date=2007-07-16 |publisher=Google Blogscoped |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref> Furthermore, Google is currently [[Fortune Magazine]]'s fourth best place to work<ref name="best_company">{{cite web |url=http://money.cnn.com/magazines/fortune/bestcompanies/2010/full_list/ |title=100 Best Companies to Work For 2010 |work=Fortune Maganize |date=2010-02-08 |publisher=CNN |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref>, and [[BrandZ]]'s most powerful brand in the world.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.millwardbrown.com/Sites/optimor/Media/Pdfs/en/BrandZ/BrandZ-2009-Report.pdf |title=Top 100 Most Powerful Brands of 2009 |year=2008 |publisher=BrandZ |page=9 |format=PDF |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref> [[Alexa Internet|Alexa]] lists Google as the Internet's most visited website.<ref>{{cite web |title=Alexa Traffic Rank for Google (three month average) |publisher=[[Alexa Internet]] |url=http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/google.com |accessdate=2009-09-06}}</ref> Google has been [[Criticism of Google|criticized]] over issues of [[privacy]] of personal information, [[copyright]] and [[censorship by Google|censorship]].
